mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: Clarysville Hospital. Civil War Records of Samuel West, Physician
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Patient Record for Barker, Edward
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Patient Name: Barker, Edward Patient Age: 17. Marital Status: Single. Diagnosis: Dislocation of right shoulder joint, [Head?] of humerus thrown inwards and upwards resting under the pectoralis major muscle, and in [contuck?] with the pectoralis minor and corocoid process of the scapula. . Location Wounded: South Branch Bridge [Virginia]. Date Wounded: 1864/09/12. Nature of Wound: Accidental . Treatment: September 13, 1864, Reduction by extension and [illegible[ extensions: by laying the patient on the floor upon his back: and by placing the hand in the axilla and laying hold of the forearm by considerable force and continued force the laxation was reduced, dressing, a wedged [illegible] in axilla the arm bound to the body by several turns of [illegible] bandage By Townsend and West . Result: Returned to Duty 1864/09/21.
